paper_abstract: Every ideal monad M on the category of sets is known to have a reflection (M) over cap in the category of all iterative monads of Elgot. Here we describe the iterative reflection (M) over cap as the monad of free iterative Eilenberg-Moore algebras for M. This yields numerous concrete examples: if M is the free-semigroup monad, then (M) over cap is obtained by adding a single absorbing element; if M is the monad of finite trees then (M) over cap is the monad of rational trees, etc. (c) 2013 Elsevier Inc. paper_title: How iterative reflections of monads are constructed
